page.title: 10Mr. Harold Crabtree
page.content: {Mr.Harold Hodgson Crabtree}has lived in Hebden Bridge all his life. He was born in Hebden Bridge, went to Central Street school, and then to Hebden Bridge Grammar School, which is now Riverside Junior School. He left school at fourteen and began shoe repairing. He now owns his own shoe shops and has been in the shoe business all his life. He was in the Army during the second world war. He became a local councillor in 1955.He was the mayor of Hebden Royd. He has seen many changes in Hebden Bridge since wind up gramophones. He remembers horses and carts carrying goods as there were few motor vehicles. Buses couldn't go to Hebden Bridge because they hadn't the power to go up Bridge Lanes. Trams ran from Hebden Bridge to Halifax. He says Hebden Bridge today is much cleaner.
